comment.author: 86615802@N05
comment._content: Possible the bottom left identification is incorrect -- John Hughes had premises here from 1865 onwards for quite a period ... so perhaps not John Hunter boot palace??

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/86615802@N05] I think you mean bottom right :) Interesting idea, you could be right as it curiously says "& Sons". Always good not to make assumptions ... but the building itself, if not that specific shopfront, is certainly John Hunter's Boot Palace - see sign immediately above: "The City Boot Palace" and at the top of the building: "Hunter's B..." which continues around the corner of the building -
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362677039/]
